message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including the cardiac murmur, bluish macules, cloudy lenses, and failed auditory screening tests, all suggest congenital rubella infection. Congenital toxoplasmosis can cause chorioretinitis, but not cardiac murmur. Congenital cytomegalovirus infection can cause hearing loss, but not cardiac murmur or bluish macules. Congenital syphilis can cause cardiac involvement, but not bluish macules, and cloudy lenses.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest Congenital Rubella Infection, which can cause heart problems (continuous heart murmur), cataracts (cloudy lenses in both eyes), hearing loss (failure to pass auditory screening), and a rash of blue or purple spots (bluish macules that do not blanch with pressure).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous heart murmur suggests a patent ductus arteriosus, which is a common finding in congenital rubella infection. The bluish macules on the skin that do not blanch with pressure suggest blueberry muffin rash, which is also seen in congenital rubella. Cloudy lenses in both eyes suggest congenital cataracts, which can also be caused by rubella. Hearing loss is a common symptom in congenital rubella as well.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a continuous heart murmur, bluish macules on the skin, and cloudy lenses in both eyes suggests congenital rubella infection. Auditory screening tests may also be affected in congenital rubella. The other options have different typical presentations, such as hepatosplenomegaly in congenital toxoplasmosis, sensorineural hearing loss in congenital cytomegalovirus infection, and Hutchinson teeth in congenital syphilis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a continuous heart murmur, bluish macules on the skin, cloudy lenses in both eyes, and failure to pass auditory screening tests are all characteristic of congenital rubella infection. Congenital toxoplasmosis would not typically present with these findings. Congenital cytomegalovirus infection can cause hearing loss and neurologic involvement, but is not typically associated with cardiac abnormalities. Congenital syphilis can cause hearing loss and skin rash, but is not typically associated with cardiac abnormalities or cloudy lenses.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The continuous heart murmur, bluish macules on the skin that do not blanch with pressure, cloudy lenses in both eyes, and failed auditory screening tests suggest congenital rubella infection.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of bluish macules that do not blanch with pressure suggests congenital rubella infection. The continuous heart murmur may be due to a patent ductus arteriosus, which is a common finding in such cases. The cloudy lenses in both eyes indicate cataracts, which are also a common finding in rubella. The auditory screening tests are not passed, further supporting congenital rubella infection as the most likely diagnosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of bluish macules on the skin that do not blanch with pressure (known as blueberry muffin rash), cloudy lenses in both eyes, and failure of auditory screening tests are all characteristic of Congenital rubella infection. The continuous heart murmur may also be associated with this infection. There is no indication of the other three options.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest congenital rubella infection. The continuous heart murmur is a common symptom, the bluish macules on the skin suggest congenital rubella syndrome, and cataracts in both eyes and auditory defects are also common symptoms. Congenital toxoplasmosis can cause a variety of symptoms but not these specific ones. Congenital cytomegalovirus infection can cause hearing loss, but not the other symptoms. Congenital syphilis can cause skin rashes and hearing loss, but not the cardiac symptoms or cloudy lenses.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of continuous heart murmur, bluish macules on the skin, and cloudy lenses in both eyes are consistent with congenital rubella infection.
